reviewText: When you get fed up with all the sitcoms and are wanting something to expand your brain rather than dull it, this is one of the shows you should watch in my opinion. Not only is it nature, but it's educational and everyone in your home can watch it. Parents can sit with their kids and learn as well as talk about the things they are seeing.. it's interaction with each other.. you remember that right? lol.. anyway.. I highly recommend this show whether you are watching it alone or with the family. You can escape to Africa and come away with a bit more knowledge and perhaps a higher level of appreciation for this world and it's wildlife.
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: For anyone who enjoys Nature and the way God's Creations in the wild are shown which Is very well this is a great series.I learned a lot, the scenery is breathtaking and the survival instincts of the animals is impressive.As far as I am concerned it is a must watch
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: One of the very best parts of amazon prime is the video. While I really wish that there were more available to watch for free with my subscription, some of the available things are amazing.  The unique qualities that exist only in Africa make it rip for an excellent documentary. This is one.
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: We enjoyed this series.  Good photography and many interesting facts
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: I hate reality tv.  90% of programming now is complete trash.  I don't stumble upon many real, old-school documentaries on tv anymore.  I'm glad I stumbled upon this one.  It's free to watch with my Amazon Prime membership, so all the better!  Wild China on BBC is even better!
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewerName: D. E. Hill "follower of the art of Natural Hi...
reviewText: This is a great widescreen (16 x 9) production, with good quality and exceptional wildlife sequences.  I have seen no better recent surveys of the natural landscape of Africa, and the group of 6 programs plus extra features is an outstanding value.  Think of a Planet Earth that focuses on the continent of Africa.
summary: Outstanding value for an excellent production
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: I really enjoyed Wild Africa - six episodes describing various parts of Africa; mountains, coasts, deserts, etc... .  Very beautiful documentary and superb narrator.  I want to see if there are any more done by the same group.  I believe this was shown through the BBC.
summary: Great wild life program - worth watching
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: I've read a little about the people of Africa and years ago had a few friends from Ghana but never really paid too much attention to the geography.  It is so diverse, I had no idea and the wild life of each area and the means they have taken over the years to adapt is simply remarkable.  I definitely would recommend the whole series t anyone with just a little interest, you won't be disappointed.
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: Each episode covers a different ecosystem on the African continent. The episodes discuss the environmental changes that have given rise to each species. I prefer looking at individual ecosystems on one continent rather than the "flying around the world" approach ofPlanet Earth. With that said, this documentary is much older thanPlanet Earth(first produced in the late 1980s), so it simply doesn't have the HD quality viewers are used to. Regardless, there are still some amazing scenes, such as sea lions sneaking up on gannets in the water and hippos fighting each other with bloody jaws. Also, the enhanced mode is actually informative and not too intrusive, mentioning interesting facts about the animals. Definitely worth checking out.
summary: An overview of the greatest continent for wildlife left
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: This series on Wild Africa is just wonderful to watch. The music is amazing as well. So much information is presented here. I could watch them over and over again and learn something new each time.
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: We love these types of shows. Very interesting.  Would love to see more nature shows like this.  Very educational to watch.
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: Another good production of many of the animals of Africa, showing their means of survival (which might be a bit more than smaller kids should see).  Showing the various areas and species of animals is entertaining and educational and is interesting to see some unexpected levels of intelligence.
summary: A good look at some of the animals in Africa
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa

reviewText: Excellent videography.  Fine, unobtrusive narration.  Presents many little known facts.  Compelling wild-life depictions. Well-placed animation segments.  Overall, very enjoyable and easy to watch. After viewing this a second time, all I could think of was "I-Max 3D."  If I had the means, it would take longer for you to read this review than the time it would take to view the movie.  But, I won't burden you with that. The videography is so spectacular that at times I thought it would have to be staged in Hollywood rather than in the wild.  The time-lapse photograhy was stunning and the wild-life footage was unbelievable. The voice-over narration was helpful but non-intrusive and showed a great deal of reasearch on the part of the producers. For a middle or high school student this is a great movie.  Given tne right amount of preparation,it could also be very productive for younger students as well.  As for me, I'm waiting for it to appear in I-Max 3-D. On a range of one to six stars, I give it a seven!
summary: A great, unfolding drama of life.
Title: BBC Atlas of the Natural World: Wild Africa
